required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Gadobutrol 1.0 Molar (Gadovist) for Breast MRI
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label, Multi-center, Phase 3 Study With Corresponding Blinded Image Reading to Determine the Efficacy and Safety of a Single Intravenous Injection of 0.1 mmol/kg Body Weight of Gadobutrol 1.0 Molar (Gadovist®) in Patients With Newly Diagnosed Breast Cancer Referred for Contrast-enhanced Breast MRI

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to look at the efficacy (how does it work) and safety of gadobutrol when used for obtaining MR images of both breasts.Women with a recent diagnosis of breast cancer by mammogram (X-ray examination of the breasts) may benefit from MRI of the breasts as MRI may detect additional breast cancers.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference for Sensitivity for Detection of Full Extent of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM Per Reader
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
primary_outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the clinical investigators and the 3 blinded readers using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value. For ease of expression, the following abbreviations will be used: Magnetic Resonance Mammography (MRM), Unenhanced MRM (UMRM), combined unenhanced and contrast (gadobutrol)-enhanced MRM (CMRM), X-ray mammography (XRM).

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity for Detection of Full Extent of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM Per Reader
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
primary_outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the clinical investigators and the 3 blinded readers using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Breast Level Specificity of CMRM for Non-malignant Breasts by Reader
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
primary_outcome.description: A non-malignant breast was defined as false positive (FP), when the reader assessed at least one breast region as malignant. When all breast regions were assessed as non-malignant, the breast was defined as true negative (TN). Breast level specificity was first defined in participant as number of TN-breasts in participant divided by number of non-malignant breasts in participant. Subsequently the specificity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the specificities across all participants who contributed with at least one non-malignant breast.

secondary_outcome.measure: Breast Level Specificity of CMRM Based on Malignant Breasts
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
secondary_outcome.description: A malignant breast was defined as false positive (FP), when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as true negative (TN). Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Difference of Participants Whose Index Cancers Were Detected Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM vs XRM, and CMRM vs CMRM+XRM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
secondary_outcome.description: Index cancer is defined as the cancer confirmed by histology prior to inclusion which made the participants eligible for the study. The difference in percentage of participants was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM value minus XRM value, CMRM value minus CMRM+XRM value respectively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Difference of Participants Whose Additional Cancers Were Detected Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM vs XRM, and CMRM vs CMRM+XRM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
secondary_outcome.description: Additional cancer was defined as cancer which was present according to SoT, but which was not defined as index cancer, i.e. was not known when the participant was enrolled into the study. The difference in percentage of participants was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM value minus XRM value, CMRM value minus CMRM+XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Breast Level Specificity for All Breasts by Imaging Modality and by Reader
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: A non-malignant breast was defined as FP when the reader assessed at least one breast region as malignant. A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as (N-FP)/N, where N was total number of breasts.

other_outcome.measure: Categorical Accuracy Difference of Extent of Malignant Disease Verified by SoT by Majority Reader, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: For each region the reader chose the category which best described the extent of malignant disease, i.e. no, unifocal, or multifocal malignant breast disease. The proportion of correct matches of each defined image set to the SoT for the extent of malignant breast disease was referred to as the categorical accuracy. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (no disease, unifocal, multifocal). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Categorical Accuracy Difference of Extent of Malignant Disease Verified by Histopathology by Majority Reader, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: For each region the reader chose the category which best described the extent of malignant disease, i.e. no, unifocal, or multifocal malignant breast disease. The proportion of correct matches of each defined image set to the SoT for the extent of malignant breast disease was referred to as the categorical accuracy. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (no disease, unifocal, multifocal). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Sensitivity Difference in the Determination of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for sensitivity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Sensitivity Difference in the Determination of Unifocal Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for sensitivity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Sensitivity Difference in the Determination of Multifocal Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for sensitivity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Specificity Difference in the Determination of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP). The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for specificity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Specificity Difference in the Determination of Unifocal Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP). The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for specificity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Specificity Difference in the Determination of Multifocal Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP). The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for specificity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Sensitivity Difference of Detection of Multicentric Malignant Disease Verified by SoT by Majority Reader, Breast Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for sensitivity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Accuracy Difference of Presence of Bilateral Malignant Disease Verified by SoT by Majority Reader, Participant Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: The disease state "bilateral malignant disease" was derived from the assessment of the different regions for each breast (right and left) for investigators for each imaging modality (UMRM, CMRM, XRM, UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM) based on the following rule: If the participant had at least one breast with no malignant region, the assessment of bilateral malignant disease was categorized as "No". If the participant had at least one malignant lesion in both breasts, the assessment of bilateral malignant disease was categorized as "Yes". The proportion of correct matches of each different image set to the SoT for the existence of bilateral malignant disease was derived. The analysis was based on the difference in accuracy for the evaluation of bilateral malignant disease for the following image comparisons on a participant level. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Difference of Confidence in Diagnosis for Breast Region Diagnosis Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM and CMRM+XRM vs XRM by Majority Reader, Participant Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: The 3 blinded readers each recorded his/her confidence in diagnosis for each breast region based on a 4-point scale (1=not confident, 2=somewhat confident, 3=confident, and 4=very confident). The majority read value for the 3 readers was determined at the disease state level (no disease, unifocal, multifocal). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers, i.e. multifocal. For each participant, the mean of the confidence responses for the diagnosed breast regions was calculated, and rounded to the nearest 0.5. value respectively. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Blinded Readers: Inter-reader Agreement on Categorical Accuracy Based on Assessment for UMRM vs CMRM - Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: Inter-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities (malignant disease / no malignant disease) for an assessment by the 2 image sets (UMRM and CMRM). Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).

other_outcome.measure: Blinded Reader 1: Intra-reader Variability Based on Assessment for CMRM - Breast Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: Intra-reader variability was assessed using a kappa on the match to SoT for the different regions within each participant (match, no match SoT). For each of the 3 readers, intra-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities for an assessment by CMRM: matched SoT or did not match SoT. Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).

other_outcome.measure: Blinded Reader 2: Intra-reader Variability Based on Assessment for CMRM - Breast Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: Intra-reader variability was assessed using a kappa on the match to SoT for the different regions within each participant (match, no match SoT). For each of the 3 readers, intra-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities for an assessment by CMRM: matched SoT or did not match SoT. Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).

other_outcome.measure: Blinded Reader 3: Intra-reader Variability Based on Assessment for CMRM - Breast Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: Intra-reader variability was assessed using a kappa on the match to SoT for the different regions within each participant (match, no match SoT). For each of the 3 readers, intra-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities for an assessment by CMRM: matched SoT or did not match SoT. Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).

other_outcome.measure: Vital Signs Change From Baseline and Follow-up 24 Hours Post Injection - Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Follow-up visit (24 hours post injection)
other_outcome.description: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure were measured in a supine position. Blood pressure was not to be measured on the arm used for the injection.

other_outcome.measure: Vital Signs Change From Baseline and Follow-up 24 Hours Post Injection - Heart Rate
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Follow-up visit (24 hours post injection)
other_outcome.description: Heart rate was measured in a supine position.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With at Least One Laboratory Parameter Change From Low or Normal at Baseline to Abnormally High at Follow-up 24 Hours Post Injection
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Follow-up visit (24 hours post injection)
other_outcome.description: Number of participants with at least one occurrence of changing from low or normal at baseline to high at follow-up.

arm_group.description: Patients first received an unenhanced MRM, followed by a gadobutrol-enhanced MRM. Gadobutrol was administered at the standard dose of 0.1 mmol/kg bw [0.1 ml/kg bw] as an intravenous injection (i.v.) injection at a rate of 2 ml/sec. UMRM and CMRM image sets were evaluated in a randomized fashion. After the evaluation of the UMRM or CMRM the respective XRM was added and evaluated together with the UMRM images.

intervention.description: A single bolus injection of gadobutrol 1.0 M 0.1mmol/kg body weight

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Recent histologically proven diagnosis of breast cancer after having obtained X-Ray Mammography (XRM) of both breasts (according to American College of Radiology [ACR] and performed no longer than 6 weeks prior to enrollment into the study) and has been referred for a contrast-enhanced Magnetic Resonance Mammography (MRM) prior to surgery of the breast.
- If female, a digital XRM is required if any of the following criteria is met:
1. patient is younger than 50 years;
2. patient has heterogeneously or extremely dense breasts;
3. is not post-menopausal (post-menopause defined as at least 12 months prior to inclusion without menstruation).
- If female of childbearing potential, MRM should be performed on the 7-14th day of the menstrual cycle.
- Has an estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) value >/= 60 mL/min/1.73m^2 derived from a serum creatinine result within 2 weeks prior to study enrollment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Is a female patient who is pregnant or lactating
- Has any contraindication to the MRM examination (e.g. metal implants, phobia) or the use of gadolinium-containing contrast agents.
- Has received any contrast agent within 24 hours prior to the study MRM, or is scheduled to receive any contrast agent within 24 hours after the study MRM.
- Has severe cardiovascular disease (e.g., known long QT syndrome, acute myocardial infarction [< 14 days], unstable angina, congestive heart failure New York Heart Association class IV) or acute stroke (< 48 hours)).
- Has acute renal insufficiency of any severity due to hepato-renal syndrome or in the peri-operative liver transplantation period or who has acute or chronic moderate or severe renal insufficiency (glomerular filtration rate < 60 mL/min/1.73m^2).
- Has received chemotherapy or hormonal therapy for breast cancer within 6 months.
- Has received hormone replacement therapy within 4 weeks prior to study drug administration.
- Is scheduled or likely to require a surgery and/or biopsy in the time period up to 24 hours following study drug application
- Has prior excisional biopsy or breast surgery less than 6 months before enrollment and between XRM and study MRM

group.title: Gadobutrol (Gadavist, BAY86-4875)
group.description: Participants first received an unenhanced magnetic resonance mammography (MRM), followed by a gadobutrol-enhanced MRM. Gadobutrol was administered at the standard dose of 0.1 mmol/kg body weight (bw) [0.1 ml/kg bw] as an intravenous injection (i.v.) at a rate of 2 ml/sec. Unenhanced MRM (UMRM) and combined unenhanced and contrast (gadobutrol)-enhanced MRM (CMRM) image sets were evaluated in a randomized fashion. After the evaluation of the UMRM or CMRM the respective X-ray mammography (XRM) was added and evaluated together with the UMRM images.

group.title: Gadobutrol (Gadavist, BAY86-4875)
group.description: Participants first received an unenhanced MRM, followed by a gadobutrol-enhanced MRM. Gadobutrol was administered at the standard dose of 0.1 mmol/kg bw [0.1 ml/kg bw] as an i.v. injection at a rate of 2 ml/sec. UMRM and CMRM image sets were evaluated in a randomized fashion. After the evaluation of the UMRM or CMRM the respective XRM was added and evaluated together with the UMRM images.

outcome.title: Difference for Sensitivity for Detection of Full Extent of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM Per Reader
outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the clinical investigators and the 3 blinded readers using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value. For ease of expression, the following abbreviations will be used: Magnetic Resonance Mammography (MRM), Unenhanced MRM (UMRM), combined unenhanced and contrast (gadobutrol)-enhanced MRM (CMRM), X-ray mammography (XRM).
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 388 participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) who had regions with malignant disease verified by Standard of Truth (SOT).

measure.title: Difference for Sensitivity for Detection of Full Extent of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM Per Reader
measure.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the clinical investigators and the 3 blinded readers using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value. For ease of expression, the following abbreviations will be used: Magnetic Resonance Mammography (MRM), Unenhanced MRM (UMRM), combined unenhanced and contrast (gadobutrol)-enhanced MRM (CMRM), X-ray mammography (XRM).
measure.population: The analyses were based on 388 participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) who had regions with malignant disease verified by Standard of Truth (SOT).

outcome.title: Sensitivity for Detection of Full Extent of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM Per Reader
outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the clinical investigators and the 3 blinded readers using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 388 participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) who had regions with malignant disease verified by Standard of Truth (SOT).

measure.title: Sensitivity for Detection of Full Extent of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM Per Reader
measure.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the clinical investigators and the 3 blinded readers using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants.
measure.population: The analyses were based on 388 participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) who had regions with malignant disease verified by Standard of Truth (SOT).

outcome.title: Breast Level Specificity of CMRM for Non-malignant Breasts by Reader
outcome.description: A non-malignant breast was defined as false positive (FP), when the reader assessed at least one breast region as malignant. When all breast regions were assessed as non-malignant, the breast was defined as true negative (TN). Breast level specificity was first defined in participant as number of TN-breasts in participant divided by number of non-malignant breasts in participant. Subsequently the specificity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the specificities across all participants who contributed with at least one non-malignant breast.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 372 participants in FAS; evaluable for specificity were breasts without malignant disease as verified by Standard of Truth (SOT).

measure.title: Breast Level Specificity of CMRM for Non-malignant Breasts by Reader
measure.description: A non-malignant breast was defined as false positive (FP), when the reader assessed at least one breast region as malignant. When all breast regions were assessed as non-malignant, the breast was defined as true negative (TN). Breast level specificity was first defined in participant as number of TN-breasts in participant divided by number of non-malignant breasts in participant. Subsequently the specificity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the specificities across all participants who contributed with at least one non-malignant breast.
measure.population: The analyses were based on 372 participants in FAS; evaluable for specificity were breasts without malignant disease as verified by Standard of Truth (SOT).

outcome.title: Breast Level Specificity of CMRM Based on Malignant Breasts
outcome.description: A malignant breast was defined as false positive (FP), when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as true negative (TN). Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP).
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 388 participants in FAS; evaluable for specificity were breasts with malignant disease verified by SoT for which an assessment by the imaging modality was available.

measure.title: Breast Level Specificity of CMRM Based on Malignant Breasts
measure.description: A malignant breast was defined as false positive (FP), when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as true negative (TN). Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP).
measure.population: The analyses were based on 388 participants in FAS; evaluable for specificity were breasts with malignant disease verified by SoT for which an assessment by the imaging modality was available.

outcome.title: Percentage Difference of Participants Whose Index Cancers Were Detected Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM vs XRM, and CMRM vs CMRM+XRM
outcome.description: Index cancer is defined as the cancer confirmed by histology prior to inclusion which made the participants eligible for the study. The difference in percentage of participants was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM value minus XRM value, CMRM value minus CMRM+XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 382 participants in FAS. Index cancer was defined as the cancer confirmed by histology prior to inclusion which made the participant eligible for the study.

measure.title: Percentage Difference of Participants Whose Index Cancers Were Detected Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM vs XRM, and CMRM vs CMRM+XRM
measure.description: Index cancer is defined as the cancer confirmed by histology prior to inclusion which made the participants eligible for the study. The difference in percentage of participants was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM value minus XRM value, CMRM value minus CMRM+XRM value respectively.
measure.population: The analyses were based on 382 participants in FAS. Index cancer was defined as the cancer confirmed by histology prior to inclusion which made the participant eligible for the study.

outcome.title: Percentage Difference of Participants Whose Additional Cancers Were Detected Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM vs XRM, and CMRM vs CMRM+XRM
outcome.description: Additional cancer was defined as cancer which was present according to SoT, but which was not defined as index cancer, i.e. was not known when the participant was enrolled into the study. The difference in percentage of participants was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM value minus XRM value, CMRM value minus CMRM+XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 87 participants in FAS who had at least one additional cancer region according to SoT.

measure.title: Percentage Difference of Participants Whose Additional Cancers Were Detected Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM vs XRM, and CMRM vs CMRM+XRM
measure.description: Additional cancer was defined as cancer which was present according to SoT, but which was not defined as index cancer, i.e. was not known when the participant was enrolled into the study. The difference in percentage of participants was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM value minus XRM value, CMRM value minus CMRM+XRM value respectively.
measure.population: The analyses were based on 87 participants in FAS who had at least one additional cancer region according to SoT.

outcome.title: Breast Level Specificity for All Breasts by Imaging Modality and by Reader
outcome.description: A non-malignant breast was defined as FP when the reader assessed at least one breast region as malignant. A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as (N–FP)/N, where N was total number of breasts.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 390 participants; evaluable for specificity were breasts with or without malignant disease verified by SoT for which assessment by the imaging modality were available.

group.title: UMRM
group.description: Before the administration of study drug unenhanced breast MRI (UMRM) were performed.

group.title: CMRM
group.description: After the administration of study drug, enhanced breast MRI were performed.

measure.title: Breast Level Specificity for All Breasts by Imaging Modality and by Reader
measure.description: A non-malignant breast was defined as FP when the reader assessed at least one breast region as malignant. A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as (N–FP)/N, where N was total number of breasts.
measure.population: The analyses were based on 390 participants; evaluable for specificity were breasts with or without malignant disease verified by SoT for which assessment by the imaging modality were available.

outcome.title: Categorical Accuracy Difference of Extent of Malignant Disease Verified by SoT by Majority Reader, Breast Region Level
outcome.description: For each region the reader chose the category which best described the extent of malignant disease, i.e. no, unifocal, or multifocal malignant breast disease. The proportion of correct matches of each defined image set to the SoT for the extent of malignant breast disease was referred to as the categorical accuracy. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (no disease, unifocal, multifocal). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were performed for a total number of 3883 regions, 390 participants in FAS.

measure.title: Categorical Accuracy Difference of Extent of Malignant Disease Verified by SoT by Majority Reader, Breast Region Level
measure.description: For each region the reader chose the category which best described the extent of malignant disease, i.e. no, unifocal, or multifocal malignant breast disease. The proportion of correct matches of each defined image set to the SoT for the extent of malignant breast disease was referred to as the categorical accuracy. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (no disease, unifocal, multifocal). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
measure.population: The analyses were performed for a total number of 3883 regions, 390 participants in FAS.

outcome.title: Categorical Accuracy Difference of Extent of Malignant Disease Verified by Histopathology by Majority Reader, Breast Region Level
outcome.description: For each region the reader chose the category which best described the extent of malignant disease, i.e. no, unifocal, or multifocal malignant breast disease. The proportion of correct matches of each defined image set to the SoT for the extent of malignant breast disease was referred to as the categorical accuracy. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (no disease, unifocal, multifocal). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were performed for a total number of 1120 regions, 390 participants from FAS.

measure.title: Categorical Accuracy Difference of Extent of Malignant Disease Verified by Histopathology by Majority Reader, Breast Region Level
measure.description: For each region the reader chose the category which best described the extent of malignant disease, i.e. no, unifocal, or multifocal malignant breast disease. The proportion of correct matches of each defined image set to the SoT for the extent of malignant breast disease was referred to as the categorical accuracy. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (no disease, unifocal, multifocal). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
measure.population: The analyses were performed for a total number of 1120 regions, 390 participants from FAS.

outcome.title: Sensitivity Difference in the Determination of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for sensitivity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were performed for a total number of 643 regions, 390 participants in FAS. Regions with malignant disease verified by SoT comprise unifocal and multifocal regions.

measure.title: Sensitivity Difference in the Determination of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
measure.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for sensitivity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
measure.population: The analyses were performed for a total number of 643 regions, 390 participants in FAS. Regions with malignant disease verified by SoT comprise unifocal and multifocal regions.

outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for sensitivity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

outcome.title: Sensitivity Difference in the Determination of Multifocal Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level

The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: For multifocal malignant disease, sensitivity analyses were performed for a total number of 67 regions.

measure.title: Sensitivity Difference in the Determination of Multifocal Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
measure.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for sensitivity). outcome.title: Specificity Difference in the Determination of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
outcome.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP). The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for specificity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were performed for a total number of 3240 regions, 390 participants in FAS.

measure.title: Specificity Difference in the Determination of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
measure.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP). The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for specificity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: For unifocal malignant disease, specificity analyses were based on a total number of 3307 regions (i.e. regions with no disease or multifocal malignant disease), 390 participants in FAS.

measure.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP). The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for specificity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
measure.population: For unifocal malignant disease, specificity analyses were based on a total number of 3307 regions (i.e. regions with no disease or multifocal malignant disease), 390 participants in FAS.

outcome.title: Specificity Difference in the Determination of Multifocal Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
outcome.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP). The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for specificity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Single examination
outcome.population: For multifocal malignant disease, specificity analyses were based on a total number of 3816 regions, 390 participants in FAS.

measure.title: Specificity Difference in the Determination of Multifocal Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
measure.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP). The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for specificity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
measure.population: For multifocal malignant disease, specificity analyses were based on a total number of 3816 regions, 390 participants in FAS.

outcome.title: Sensitivity Difference of Detection of Multicentric Malignant Disease Verified by SoT by Majority Reader, Breast Level
outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for sensitivity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on a total number of 53 evaluable breasts with multicentric malignant disease.

measure.title: Sensitivity Difference of Detection of Multicentric Malignant Disease Verified by SoT by Majority Reader, Breast Level
measure.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The majority read value for the 3 blinded readers was determined at the disease state level (evaluable regions for sensitivity). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave a different categorical determination, the majority response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
measure.population: The analyses were based on a total number of 53 evaluable breasts with multicentric malignant disease.

outcome.title: Accuracy Difference of Presence of Bilateral Malignant Disease Verified by SoT by Majority Reader, Participant Level
outcome.description: The disease state “bilateral malignant disease” was derived from the assessment of the different regions for each breast (right and left) for investigators for each imaging modality (UMRM, CMRM, XRM, UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM) based on the following rule: If the participant had at least one breast with no malignant region, the assessment of bilateral malignant disease was categorized as “No”. If the participant had at least one malignant lesion in both breasts, the assessment of bilateral malignant disease was categorized as “Yes”. The proportion of correct matches of each different image set to the SoT for the existence of bilateral malignant disease was derived. The analysis was based on the difference in accuracy for the evaluation of bilateral malignant disease for the following image comparisons on a participant level. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 388 participants; evaluable subjects with at least one region verified by SoT in each breast with available CMRM, UMRM, CMRM+XRM, UMRM+XRM and XRM assessment.

measure.title: Accuracy Difference of Presence of Bilateral Malignant Disease Verified by SoT by Majority Reader, Participant Level
measure.description: The disease state “bilateral malignant disease” was derived from the assessment of the different regions for each breast (right and left) for investigators for each imaging modality (UMRM, CMRM, XRM, UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM) based on the following rule: If the participant had at least one breast with no malignant region, the assessment of bilateral malignant disease was categorized as “No”. If the participant had at least one malignant lesion in both breasts, the assessment of bilateral malignant disease was categorized as “Yes”. The proportion of correct matches of each different image set to the SoT for the existence of bilateral malignant disease was derived. The analysis was based on the difference in accuracy for the evaluation of bilateral malignant disease for the following image comparisons on a participant level. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
measure.population: The analyses were based on 388 participants; evaluable subjects with at least one region verified by SoT in each breast with available CMRM, UMRM, CMRM+XRM, UMRM+XRM and XRM assessment.

outcome.title: Difference of Confidence in Diagnosis for Breast Region Diagnosis Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM and CMRM+XRM vs XRM by Majority Reader, Participant Level
outcome.description: The 3 blinded readers each recorded his/her confidence in diagnosis for each breast region based on a 4-point scale (1=not confident, 2=somewhat confident, 3=confident, and 4=very confident). The majority read value for the 3 readers was determined at the disease state level (no disease, unifocal, multifocal). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers, i.e. multifocal. For each participant, the mean of the confidence responses for the diagnosed breast regions was calculated, and rounded to the nearest 0.5. value respectively. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments by the majority reader for both modalities in the comparison for this assessment. Majority reader results are based on the average of the 3 blinded readers’s assessment.

measure.title: Difference of Confidence in Diagnosis for Breast Region Diagnosis Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM and CMRM+XRM vs XRM by Majority Reader, Participant Level
measure.description: The 3 blinded readers each recorded his/her confidence in diagnosis for each breast region based on a 4-point scale (1=not confident, 2=somewhat confident, 3=confident, and 4=very confident). The majority read value for the 3 readers was determined at the disease state level (no disease, unifocal, multifocal). If 2 of 3 or all 3 readers gave the same categorical determination of malignant disease for a breast region, the majority reader response was that category. If all 3 readers gave different categorical determination, the majority reader response was the most severe disease category given by any of the 3 readers, i.e. multifocal. For each participant, the mean of the confidence responses for the diagnosed breast regions was calculated, and rounded to the nearest 0.5. value respectively. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
measure.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments by the majority reader for both modalities in the comparison for this assessment. Majority reader results are based on the average of the 3 blinded readers’s assessment.
measure.units: difference of scores on a scale

outcome.title: Blinded Readers: Inter-reader Agreement on Categorical Accuracy Based on Assessment for UMRM vs CMRM - Breast Region Level
outcome.description: Inter-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities (malignant disease / no malignant disease) for an assessment by the 2 image sets (UMRM and CMRM). Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure.

measure.title: Blinded Readers: Inter-reader Agreement on Categorical Accuracy Based on Assessment for UMRM vs CMRM - Breast Region Level
measure.description: Inter-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities (malignant disease / no malignant disease) for an assessment by the 2 image sets (UMRM and CMRM). Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).
measure.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Blinded Reader 1: Intra-reader Variability Based on Assessment for CMRM - Breast Level
outcome.description: Intra-reader variability was assessed using a kappa on the match to SoT for the different regions within each participant (match, no match SoT). For each of the 3 readers, intra-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities for an assessment by CMRM: matched SoT or did not match SoT. Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure.

measure.title: Blinded Reader 1: Intra-reader Variability Based on Assessment for CMRM - Breast Level
measure.description: Intra-reader variability was assessed using a kappa on the match to SoT for the different regions within each participant (match, no match SoT). For each of the 3 readers, intra-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities for an assessment by CMRM: matched SoT or did not match SoT. Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).
measure.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Blinded Reader 2: Intra-reader Variability Based on Assessment for CMRM - Breast Level
outcome.description: Intra-reader variability was assessed using a kappa on the match to SoT for the different regions within each participant (match, no match SoT). For each of the 3 readers, intra-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities for an assessment by CMRM: matched SoT or did not match SoT. Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure

measure.title: Blinded Reader 2: Intra-reader Variability Based on Assessment for CMRM - Breast Level
measure.description: Intra-reader variability was assessed using a kappa on the match to SoT for the different regions within each participant (match, no match SoT). For each of the 3 readers, intra-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities for an assessment by CMRM: matched SoT or did not match SoT. Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).
measure.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure

outcome.title: Blinded Reader 3: Intra-reader Variability Based on Assessment for CMRM - Breast Level
outcome.description: Intra-reader variability was assessed using a kappa on the match to SoT for the different regions within each participant (match, no match SoT). For each of the 3 readers, intra-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities for an assessment by CMRM: matched SoT or did not match SoT. Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure.

measure.title: Blinded Reader 3: Intra-reader Variability Based on Assessment for CMRM - Breast Level
measure.description: Intra-reader variability was assessed using a kappa on the match to SoT for the different regions within each participant (match, no match SoT). For each of the 3 readers, intra-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities for an assessment by CMRM: matched SoT or did not match SoT. Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).
measure.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Vital Signs Change From Baseline and Follow–up 24 Hours Post Injection - Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure
outcome.description: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure were measured in a supine position. Blood pressure was not to be measured on the arm used for the injection.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Follow–up visit (24 hours post injection)
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAF): The analysis of safety data was performed using all available data from all participants who administered any amount of gadobutrol.

group.title: Gadobutrol (Gadavist, BAY86-4875)
group.description: Participants first received an unenhanced MRM, followed by a gadobutrol-enhanced MRM. Gadobutrol was administered at the standard dose of 0.1 mmol/kg bw [0.1 ml/kg bw] as an i.v. injection at a rate of 2 ml/sec. UMRM and CMRM image sets were evaluated in a randomized fashion. After the evaluation of the UMRM or CMRM the respective XRM was added and evaluated together with the UMRM images.

measure.title: Vital Signs Change From Baseline and Follow–up 24 Hours Post Injection - Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure
measure.description: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure were measured in a supine position. Blood pressure was not to be measured on the arm used for the injection.
measure.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAF): The analysis of safety data was performed using all available data from all participants who administered any amount of gadobutrol.

outcome.title: Vital Signs Change From Baseline and Follow–up 24 Hours Post Injection - Heart Rate
outcome.description: Heart rate was measured in a supine position.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Follow–up visit (24 hours post injection)
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAF): The analysis of safety data was performed using all available data from all participants who administered any amount of gadobutrol.

measure.title: Vital Signs Change From Baseline and Follow–up 24 Hours Post Injection - Heart Rate
measure.description: Heart rate was measured in a supine position.
measure.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAF): The analysis of safety data was performed using all available data from all participants who administered any amount of gadobutrol.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With at Least One Laboratory Parameter Change From Low or Normal at Baseline to Abnormally High at Follow–up 24 Hours Post Injection
outcome.description: Number of participants with at least one occurrence of changing from low or normal at baseline to high at follow-up.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Follow–up visit (24 hours post injection)
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAF): The analysis of safety data was performed using all available data from all participants who administered any amount of gadobutrol.

group.title: Gadobutrol (Gadavist, BAY86-4875)
group.description: Participants first received an unenhanced MRM, followed by a gadobutrol-enhanced MRM. Gadobutrol was administered at the standard dose of 0.1 mmol/kg bw [0.1 ml/kg bw] as an i.v. injection at a rate of 2 ml/sec. UMRM and CMRM image sets were evaluated in a randomized fashion. After the evaluation of the UMRM or CMRM the respective XRM was added and evaluated together with the UMRM images.

measure.title: Number of Participants With at Least One Laboratory Parameter Change From Low or Normal at Baseline to Abnormally High at Follow–up 24 Hours Post Injection
measure.description: Number of participants with at least one occurrence of changing from low or normal at baseline to high at follow-up.
measure.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAF): The analysis of safety data was performed using all available data from all participants who administered any amount of gadobutrol.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events (AEs) that newly started between start of contrast injection and up to 24 hours post-contrast.

group.title: Gadobutrol (Gadavist, BAY 86-4875)
group.description: Participants first received an unenhanced magnetic resonance mammography (MRM), followed by a gadobutrol-enhanced MRM. Gadobutrol was administered at the standard dose of 0.1 mmol/kg body weight (bw) [0.1 ml/kg bw] as an intravenous injection at a rate of 2 ml/sec. Unenhanced MRM (UMRM) and combined unenhanced and contrast (gadobutrol)-enhanced MRM (CMRM) image sets were evaluated in a randomized fashion. After the evaluation of the UMRM or CMRM the respective X-ray mammography (XRM) was added and evaluated together with the UMRM images.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
